intro: Draba verna var. rurivaga, commonly known as the early spring rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm. This variety is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, glaucous leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. The plant is adapted to cold climates and is known for its ability to survive in nutrient-poor conditions.
